definition: to invite a snub/to court a rebuff

sentences.english: Feeling he was not wanted, he walked away looking embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得没趣，只好讪讪地走开了。

sentences.english: A: The shows are dull and they’re too many advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 这些节目都很没趣，而且广告太多了。

sentences.english: Studies the intelligent spot, do not have a joke backfire.
sentences.chinese: 学聪明点吧，不要自讨没趣。

sentences.english: No-one in their right mind can claim that Chelsea were boring.
sentences.chinese: 脑筋正常的人是不会说切尔西很没趣的。

sentences.english: The shows are dull and they're too many advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 这些节目都很没趣，而且广告太多了。

sentences.english: Can I please go to work and humiliate myself now?
sentences.chinese: 我能去上班顺便自讨没趣了吗？

sentences.english: I went to the General office, and ate dirt.
sentences.chinese: 我到总办事处去，结果自讨没趣。

sentences.english: You will be disselected to the result.
sentences.chinese: 这个结果将会使你没趣。

sentences.english: This is the least interesting book I've ever read.
sentences.chinese: 这是我所读过的最没趣的书。

sentences.english: If that person can't figure out who are you, aren't you just asking for trouble?
sentences.chinese: 要是人家想不出或猜不着你是谁，岂非自讨没趣？

sentences.english: She know how to score off people who ask difficult question.
sentences.chinese: 她很会让那些给她出难题的人自讨没趣。

sentences.english: He looked without much interest at the unmoving figures all around him.
sentences.chinese: 他没趣地打量着自己周围的一动不动的蜡像。

sentences.english: One of my favourite lines is that "normal is boring".
sentences.chinese: 用我最喜欢的一句话来形容，“正常是最没趣的”。

definition: to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
to acknowledge/to respond/to answer/to pay attention/to heed/to deal with
not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond
not to pay attention to/to leave sth as it is/to ignore
